hooks.command: node -e "const data = JSON.parse(process.argv[1]); const path = data.tool_input?.file_path || data.tool_input?.path || ''; const forbidden = ['.env', 'package-lock.json', '.git/', 'node_modules/', '.claude/settings.json']; const blocked = forbidden.some(p => path.includes(p)); if (blocked) { console.error('âš ï¸  Blocked access to sensitive file: ' + path); process.exit(2); } process.exit(0);" "$(cat)"
cd $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR && npx prettier --write $CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS 2>/dev/null && npx eslint --fix $CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS 2>/dev/null || true

hooks.description: Stage changes and show git status

hooks.command: cd $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR && if [[ $CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS == *.ts* ]]; then npx tsc --noEmit 2>&1 | head -20 || echo 'âœ… TypeScript check passed'; fi
cd $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR && npm test 2>&1 | tee test-results.log || echo 'Tests completed with errors - check test-results.log'
hooks.description: Run tests after editing source files

hooks.command: cd $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR && if [ "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then git add -A && git commit -m "Auto-commit: Changes made by Claude Code" && echo 'âœ… Changes auto-committed'; else echo 'â„¹ï¸ No changes to commit'; fi

cd $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR && echo 'ðŸ“„ New file created: '$CLAUDE_FILE_PATH && if [[ $CLAUDE_FILE_PATH == *.test.* ]] || [[ $CLAUDE_FILE_PATH == *.spec.* ]]; then echo 'ðŸ§ª Test file detected - remember to run tests'; fi
echo 'âŒ Error occurred!' && cd $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR && git status --short && echo '---' && git diff --stat
find $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR -name '*.backup' -type f -mmin +60 -delete 2>/dev/null && echo 'ðŸ§¹ Cleaned up old backup files (>1 hour)' || true

if command -v notify-send >/dev/null 2>&1; then notify-send -u normal -t 5000 'Claude Code' 'Awaiting your input'; elif command -v osascript >/dev/null 2>&1; then osascript -e 'display notification "Awaiting your input" with title "Claude Code"'; else echo 'ðŸ”” Claude needs your input'; fi
